topic.title: Connecting to Your Own Enterprise Server

keywords.indexterm: Connecting to your own Enterprise server

body.p: It is possible for your organization to use your own server to store uploaded content rather than the server hosted by the . Your system administrator will first need to set up and configure your Enterprise server and they can either use a properties file to impose the Enterprise server address or you can manually configure Oxygen XML Editor/Author to connect to your Enterprise server.

section.title: Manually Configuring Oxygen XML Editor/Author to Connect to Your Enterprise Server
section.p:
If your organization is not using a properties file to impose the Enterprise server address, you will need to have your version of Oxygen XML Editor/Author manually configured to connect to your Enterprise server:
Install the Oxygen Content Fusion Connector add-on in Oxygen XML Editor/Author.
Go to Options / Preferences / Plugins / Oxygen Content Fusion Connector.
Enter the address of your Enterprise server in the Server URL field and click OK (for example,http://fusion.example.com).
Click the Show Content Fusion Task Manager toolbar button to display the task management view.
Click Connect to open the interface in your default browser.If a connection to the server could not be established, a Choose the Oxygen Content Fusion server box will be displayed. You can select the Enterprise radio button, enter the address of your server (it must be a valid URL), click Connect, and this will also automatically set the address of your server in the preference page described in steps 2 and 3.
If this is your first time using , click on SIGN UP and follow the instructions to create your account. If you already have an account, click Authorize.
Result: Now, when you upload tasks, the documents will be stored on your server, instead of the server hosted by the .

section.title: Changing the Enterprise Server Address in Oxygen XML Editor/Author
section.p:
To change the server address of your Enterprise server, use the following procedure:
In Oxygen XML Editor/Author, go to Options / Preferences / Plugins / Oxygen Content Fusion Connector.
Enter the new address in the Server URL field.
Click OK.

Result: Now, when you click Connect in the Content Fusion Tasks Manager view and you click Authorize in the browser interface, you will be connected to your server rather than the server hosted by the .

section.title: Switching Back to the Default Server in Oxygen XML Editor/Author
section.p:
To switch back to the default server hosted by the , use the following procedure:
In Oxygen XML Editor/Author, go to Options / Preferences / Plugins / Oxygen Content Fusion Connector.
Click the Restore Defaults button at the bottom-right of the preferences page.
Click OK.

Result: Now, when you click Connect in the Content Fusion Tasks Manager view (make sure the Public radio button is selected) and you click Authorize in the browser interface, you will be connected to the default server hosted by the .
